info.game_comments: (Sarah: Hi, I'm Sarah.  Today on Jeopardy! the Clue  Crew is going to a yard sale.  Come on along.)

(1, 1).clue: Because he was not well enough known, Gene Hackman lost the role of Mike Brady to this actor

(5, 1).clue: The name of this legislative body has the same root as the word senile

(6, 1).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew at a yard sale.) What a deal --75 cents for a statue of this enlightened one --good karma is included.

(1, 2).clue: In a little "Monkee" business, Marcia promised she'd get this singer to perform at the prom

(2, 2).clue: Granite Peak is the highest point in this state whose postal abbreviation also stands for "mountain"

(3, 2).clue: The Queen of Hearts made some (5)

(4, 2).clue: U.S. unit of measure equivalent to .9144 meters

(5, 2).clue: This word for the building where legislatures meet comes from the hill in Rome where the Temple of Jupiter stood

(6, 2).clue: (Sofia of the Clue Crew at a yard sale.) No wonder the lunchbox featuring this 1980s Latin band is only 50 cents --no Ricky Martin

(1, 3).clue: A little jealous,  this middle daughter bemoaned, "All I ever hear is 'Marcia, Marcia, Marcia'!"

(2, 3).clue: Containing over 75 percent of the U.S. land over 10,000 feet, this is the state with the highest mean elevation

(4, 3).clue: Circles, thermometers & college grads are marked by the number of these they have

(5, 3).clue: A eulogy of Dolley Madison by President Taylor in 1849 gave us this 2-word term

(6, 3).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew at a yard sale.) Holy cow --an original printing of this document that begins, "When in the course of human events..." Take 2 bucks?

(1, 4).clue: On "The Personality Kid" episode, Peter in his best Bogart voice, kept mentioning pork chops & this food

(2, 4).clue: 1965's Freedom March took place entirely within this state

(4, 4).clue: If your checkerboard  squares are 1 inch square each, they form a standard board with this many square inches

(5, 4).clue: This word comes from the name of a person & the voting district he created that looked like a salamander

(6, 4).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew at a yard sale.) Ooh, 75 cents for a mug made of this alloy of tin and copper

(1, 5).clue: In 1999 Barry Williams released a CD, "The Return of" this pop star, his alter ego on the show

(2, 5).clue: Though its name is from Algonquin for "tribe" of superior men", this state is on Lake Michigan

(4, 5).clue: One weight still used form the old apothecaries' system is this ounce

(5, 5).clue: This term for an election item comes from the small balls Italian citizens used as a method of voting

(6, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew at a yard sale.) Hey, $3 will get you a framed print of "Starry Night" by this painter

(1, 1).clue: In 2000 a tradition was shaken as bobbies in Nottingham began carrying these

(2, 1).clue: He's the Irish actor seen here in the role that made him a star

(3, 1).clue: In 1867 Edvard Grieg founded the Norwegian Academy of Music in this city, then known as Christiania

(4, 1).clue: In the military it's leaving one's unit; in civilian life, the abandonment of one's spouse or children

(5, 1).clue: Born in Norwich, Connecticut on Jan. 14, 1741 he'd betray his new country 39 years later

(6, 1).clue: Pia Zadora helps this jolly gift giver when he "Conquers the Martians" in a 1964 cult movie classic

(1, 2).clue: Many bobbies work for the Met short for this "police service" originally founded in 1829

(2, 2).clue: He's directed more than 15 films, including "The Last Picture Show" & "Texasville"

(3, 2).clue: In 1970, this actress seen here made her movie debut as Edvard Grieg's wife in "Song of Norway"

(4, 2).clue: It can mean to diabolically possess someone, or to represent him as evil or diabolical

(5, 2).clue: On Jan. 7, 1972 Lewis Powell & this future Chief Justice were sworn in as Supreme Court Justices

(6, 2).clue: From the Greek for "little rod", these organisms kill off the invading martians in "War of the Worlds"

(1, 3).clue: In 1974 the police force of this second-largest English city was folded into the West Midlands Police

(2, 3).clue: He won a Supporting Actor Oscar for 1960's "Spartacus" & for 1964's "Topkapi"

(3, 3).clue: These 2 top British universities awarded Grieg honorary Mus.D. degrees

(2, 4).clue: His roles have included the monster in "Young Frankenstein" & Ray Romano's dad
